titleInfo.title: USA v. Owens et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Glenn Edward McGowan (2): For all reasons stated by the magistrate judge in his 67 Order dated 9/23/2013, the Court finds by clear and convincing evidence that there are no conditions of McGowan's release that could assure the safety of the community. Thus, the Court ORDERS that McGowan's 83 MOTION to Revoke Detention Order and set bond is DENIED. Signed by Judge Karen K. Caldwell on 10/23/2013. (KLB) cc: COR,USM,USP

titleInfo.title: USA v. Owens et al
titleInfo.subTitle: OPINION AND ORDER as to Dequawn Lamar Hopkins, LaShawn Dewayne Hopkins, Khaaliq Alim Owens, Brandon Hendrick James Pressley, Thomas Dajuan Brown: 1) Dft Pressley's 97 MOTION to Exclude Evidence is DENIED as explained. 2) Dft Pressley's 98 MOTION to Sever Defendant is DENIED. 3) The 96 MOTION to Sever Defendant and 101 MOTION to Sever Defendant are DENIED as moot; and 4) The 103 MOTION for Extension of Time for Rearraignment and 104 MOTION for Extension of Time to File Motion for Rearraignment are GRANTED and their motions for rearraignment will be deemed timely filed. Signed by Judge Karen K. Caldwell on 2/24/2014. titleInfo.title: USA v. Owens et al
titleInfo.subTitle: OPINION AND ORDER as to Khaaliq Alim Owens: The Court ORDERS as follows: 1) Dft's 237 MOTION to Reconsider is GRANTED in part and DENIED in part as follows: a) Court clarifies that, if government has in its possession, custody/control any IRS Forms that 1) are material to preparing the defense of this matter; 2) the government intends to use in its case-in-chief at trial; or 3) were obtained from or belonged to dft, then it SHALL produce those items to dft's counsel w/in 48 hours of receipt of this order; & 2) the 237 motion for reconsideration is otherwise DENIED. Signed by Judge Karen K. Caldwell on June 18, 2014. (MWZ) cc: COR (Dft via U.S. Mail),USM,USP

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 5:13-cr-00123; USA v. Owens et al;

Signed by Judge Karen K. Caldwell on June 18, 2014. (MWZ) cc: COR (Dft via U.S. Mail),USM,USP
